alert.note: Alert for Hall (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 10 at 11:15PM CDT until May 11 at 1:00AM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 130 AM CDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Eastern Hall County and Childress County. This includes the cities of Childress and Memphis and US-287 between Goodlett and Memphis. * WHEN...Until 130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways resulting in hazardous driving conditions. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1111 PM CDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain due to slow-moving thunderstorms. Nearby Mesonet sites have reported 0.60 inches of rainfall in as little as 10 minutes. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Up to 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts up to 2 inches are expected over the area as additional thunderstorms move into the region from the south. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Childress, Memphis, Tell, Kirkland and Estelline. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service.
